intro: Pyrrosia medogensis, commonly known as the Yunnan moss fern, is a rare and endangered species native to China. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its small, leathery fronds with a distinctive, serrated margin. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in mountainous regions with high humidity and poor soil conditions. Its spores are produced on the underside of the fronds, and it reproduces through both sexual and asexual means. Due to habitat destruction and limited distribution, conservation efforts are crucial for its survival.
